sections.title: Disclosure of Interests in Other Entities
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 12.

items.question: Does the entity prepare consolidated financial statements under IFRS 10?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose information about significant judgements and assumptions it has made (and changes to those judgements and assumptions) in determining that it has control of another entity, i.e., an investee?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare consolidated financial statements under IFRS 10?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and ensure they are prepared under the consolidation requirements of IFRS 10. Typically, consolidated financial statements are required when the entity controls one or more subsidiaries. If the entity does not have any subsidiaries, this question is 'Not Applicable'.

yes_case.question: Does the entity determine that it has control over one or more investees?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity's assessment of control over investees, as defined in IFRS 10. Control exists if the entity has power over the investee, exposure or rights to variable returns, and the ability to affect returns through control. Common pitfalls include incorrectly assessing control based on ownership percentage alone.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it has control over another entity (including changes to those judgements and assumptions)?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity's disclosures in the notes to the financial statements. Ensure that significant judgements and assumptions, including any changes, are disclosed. These disclosures should provide clarity on how control was assessed and the reasons behind such conclusions.

items.question: Do any changes in facts and circumstances during the reporting period indicate a change in the conclusion about whether the entity has control over an investee?
items.original_question: Does the entity include under the significant judgements and assumptions disclosed in IFRS 12.7 those made when changes in facts and circumstances are such that the conclusion about whether it has control changes during the reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Do any changes in facts and circumstances during the reporting period indicate a change in the conclusion about whether the entity has control over an investee?
decision_tree.guidance: Review board minutes, contracts, agreements, and any changes in shareholdings or governance. Pay special attention to events that might result in reconsideration of control, such as changes in voting rights, protective rights, or potential voting rights. Cross-reference the assessment of control with IFRS 10 Consolidated Financial Statements.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the significant judgements and assumptions made when re-assessing control under IFRS 12.7?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements. Look for disclosures that explain the judgements and assumptions used to determine whether control exists or ceases to exist, particularly any changes resulting from new facts and circumstances. Common disclosure areas include the basis for loss or acquisition of control.

items.question: Does the entity hold more than half of the voting rights of another entity?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it does not control another entity even though it holds more than half of the voting rights of that entity?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity hold more than half of the voting rights of another entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and supporting documentation, such as ownership structures and share registers. Verify whether the entity's voting rights exceed 50% for any investee. Focus only on situations where the ownership condition is met.

yes_case.question: Has the entity concluded that it does NOT control the other entity despite holding more than half of the voting rights?
yes_case.guidance: Check the entity's assessment in accordance with IFRS 10 Consolidated Financial Statements, particularly paragraphs 7-9, regarding control and decision-making rights. Verify any documentation or memos that explain why the entity believes it does not have control. Ensure the reasoning is clear and consistent.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it does not control the other entity?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements to confirm that significant judgements and assumptions are disclosed, as required by IFRS 12.9(a). Pay attention to detailed explanations regarding voting rights, contractual agreements, or other factors affecting control.

items.question: Does the entity control another entity while holding less than half of the voting rights of that entity?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it controls another entity even though it holds less than half of the voting rights of that entity?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity control another entity while holding less than half of the voting rights of that entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the consolidation details in the entity's financial statements and supporting documentation to identify cases where the entity consolidates another entity despite holding less than 50% of voting rights. Look for references to agreements, practical control mechanisms, or other factors indicating control even with minority voting rights.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it controls the other entity?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements under 'Significant Judgements' or related sections. Ensure the entity has explicitly described the key judgements and assumptions underpinning the control decision, such as contractual arrangements, de facto control, or the dominance of decision-making rights.

items.question: Has the entity entered into arrangements where it could act as an agent or a principal?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it is an agent or a principal?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity entered into arrangements where it could act as an agent or a principal?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the contracts, agreements, or business arrangements disclosed in the entity’s financial statements or supporting documentation. Look for relationships involving decision-making authority, control, or intermediary roles. Cross-reference IFRS 12 for definitions and examples related to agent-principal evaluations.

yes_case.question: Has the entity made significant judgements or assumptions to determine whether it is an agent or a principal?
yes_case.guidance: Analyze the accounting policies and relevant disclosures in the notes to the financial statements. Look for areas where management has used estimates or assumptions to decide its role as an agent or principal. Pay attention to whether the entity explicitly mentions reliance on IFRS 12’s guidance to make such determinations. Ensure that these judgements relate specifically to relationships covered under IFRS 12 requirements.

yes_case.question: Has the entity adequately disclosed these significant judgements and assumptions in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statement notes under disclosures related to investments or arrangements where the agent-principal determination applies. Ensure that the disclosures provide sufficient detail about the judgements and assumptions used, as required under IFRS 12.9(c). Confirm they are understandable and relevant to stakeholders.

items.question: Does the entity consolidate financial statements as a group with subsidiaries?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose enough information to understand the composition of the group, including the group's composition and the interest that non-controlling interests have in the group's activities and cash flows?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity consolidate financial statements as a group with subsidiaries?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements, particularly the consolidation section in compliance with IFRS 10. Verify whether the entity controls one or more subsidiaries, requiring group-level financial statements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity have non-controlling interests in its subsidiaries?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements and the notes for disclosures about ownership structure. Non-controlling interests typically arise when the entity owns less than 100% of a subsidiary but still exercises control.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose information sufficient to understand the composition of the group and the interest non-controlling interests have in the group's activities and cash flows?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to IFRS 12.10–12.12 and confirm whether the notes or accompanying disclosures explain: 1) the composition of the group, 2) material arrangements affecting activities, and 3) the impact of non-controlling interests (e.g., share of profit or loss, cash flows). Disclosures should be clear, complete, and reconciled to structural financial data.

items.question: Does the entity have significant restrictions on its ability to access or use group assets or to settle group liabilities?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose enough information to evaluate the nature and extent of significant restrictions on its ability to access or use group assets and to settle group liabilities?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have significant restrictions on its ability to access or use group assets or to settle group liabilities?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's consolidated financial statements and supporting notes. Look for disclosures or agreements indicating restrictions, such as legal, contractual, or other regulatory limitations preventing the use or settlement of group assets and liabilities. Focus on subsidiaries, joint arrangements, and associates.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose enough information to evaluate the nature and extent of these significant restrictions?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that the financial statement notes provide detailed information on the restrictions, including their nature, the entities or assets involved, the basis for the restrictions, and their financial impact on the group. Reference IFRS 12.13 for specific disclosure requirements.

items.question: Does the entity have interests in consolidated structured entities?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose enough information to evaluate the nature of, and changes in, the risks associated with its interests in consolidated structured entities?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have interests in consolidated structured entities?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity’s financial statements (specifically the notes) to determine whether it holds interests in structured entities that fall under the definition in IFRS 12. Confirm that these entities are consolidated as per IFRS 10.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed information to evaluate the nature of the risks associated with its interests in consolidated structured entities?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements for disclosures pursuant to IFRS 12.14–12.17. This includes qualitative and quantitative information about risks (e.g., credit risk, liquidity risk) linked to the structured entities consolidated by the entity.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed information to evaluate changes in the risks associated with its interests in consolidated structured entities?
yes_case.guidance: Look for disclosures that explicitly describe how the risks associated with consolidated structured entities have evolved during the reporting period. This may include impacts from market changes, modifications in the entities' operations, or shifts in economic conditions.

items.question: Does the entity have any changes in ownership interest in a subsidiary during the reporting period that did not result in a loss of control?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose enough information to evaluate the consequences of changes in its ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in a loss of control?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have any changes in ownership interest in a subsidiary during the reporting period that did not result in a loss of control?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the consolidated financial statements, specifically footnotes or disclosures about subsidiaries. Look for transactions where ownership percentages changed but the parent entity retained control. Control is typically defined as having more than 50% voting rights or power to govern financial and operating policies.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed sufficient information about the nature and financial effects of each change in ownership interest?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosures under IFRS 12 in the notes. Verify whether details on the reasons for these changes, their financial impact, and the method of accounting are included. Ensure compliance with IFRS 12.18, which requires clear and thorough explanations.

items.question: Has the entity lost control of a subsidiary during the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose enough information to evaluate the consequences of losing control of a subsidiary during the reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity lost control of a subsidiary during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the Consolidated Financial Statements. Check for derecognition of subsidiaries in the reporting period. Look in the 'Changes in Group Structure' note or similar disclosures for any mention of loss of control events.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed sufficient information to evaluate the consequences of losing control of the subsidiary?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that the financial statements include details such as the gain or loss recognized on loss of control, the valuation of remaining interests (if any), and relevant details as per IFRS 12 paragraph 19. Consult the disclosures for qualitative and quantitative explanations of the consequences to the group structure, financial performance, and financial position.

items.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries whose financial statements are used for consolidation?
items.original_question: When a subsidiary's financial statements used for consolidation are as of a different date or for a different period, does the entity disclose the date of that subsidiary's reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries whose financial statements are used for consolidation?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements, consolidation procedures, and group structure. Look for references to subsidiaries in the group financial reporting documentation and ensure accurate identification of all subsidiaries consolidated under IFRS 10. Verify the existence of subsidiaries from the notes to the financial statements or the organizational chart.

yes_case.question: Are the financial statements of any subsidiaries prepared as of a different reporting date or for a different reporting period than the entity's consolidated financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Check the reporting dates and periods explicitly mentioned in each subsidiary's financial statements compared to the consolidated group accounts. Refer to IFRS 10. B92 for guidance on aligning reporting dates and periods. Common pitfall: Ensure adjusted balances for the subsidiary reflect appropriate consolidation adjustments, if any.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reporting date or period of those subsidiaries whose financial statements are prepared as of a different date or for a different period?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statement disclosures, specifically under IFRS 12.11(a). Look for explicit mention of reporting dates or periods of such subsidiaries. Ensure the disclosures provide sufficient information for users to understand the reporting period misalignment.

items.question: Does the entity have any subsidiaries with financial statements prepared as of a different date or for a different period used for consolidation?
items.original_question: When a subsidiary's financial statements used for consolidation are as of a different date or for a different period, does the entity disclose the reason for using that different date or period?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have any subsidiaries with financial statements prepared as of a different date or for a different period used for consolidation?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the consolidation process documentation and check the reporting dates of all subsidiary financial statements against the parent company’s reporting date. Consult IFRS 10 for guidance on when this situation might arise. Ensure any adjustments for such differences are reviewed during the audit process.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reason for using the different date or period for the subsidiary's financial statements in the consolidation?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the disclosures within the consolidated financial statements, particularly in the notes section. Verify the explanation regarding the different dates or periods complies with IFRS 12.11(b). Check for clarity and consistent use of terminology.

items.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the name of each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the consolidated financial statements and identify subsidiaries. Examine the equity section and related disclosures to determine if any subsidiaries have significant ownership by parties other than the parent entity. Refer to IFRS 12 definition of 'material non-controlling interests' – these are interests that could influence decisions or provide useful information to users of financial statements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the name of each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the notes to the consolidated financial statements, specifically disclosures related to IFRS 12.12(a). Confirm whether the names of subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests are explicitly mentioned. Avoid common pitfalls such as incomplete lists or failing to distinguish subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests from other subsidiaries.

items.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the principal place of business (and country of incorporation, if different) of each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to the consolidated financial statements, specifically the ownership structure and equity disclosures. Check if the entity owns less than 100% of certain subsidiaries, and verify the materiality of the non-controlling interest based on its quantitative and qualitative impact on the financial statements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the principal place of business of each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements, especially the disclosures under IFRS 12 (e.g., sections related to subsidiaries and non-controlling interests). Ensure the location where the subsidiary’s day-to-day operations occur is disclosed. Cross-check this with subsidiary registration documents, if needed.

yes_case.question: If the country of incorporation differs from the principal place of business, does the entity disclose the country of incorporation?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the subsidiary-specific disclosures. Confirm if there are differences between the principal place of business and the legal country of incorporation. If applicable, ensure the country of incorporation is explicitly stated.

items.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the proportion of ownership interests held by non-controlling interests for each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's consolidated financial statements and related notes to identify subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests. Check the ownership structure detailed in IAS 27 or IFRS 10, focusing on interests classified as 'non-controlling'. Materiality should be assessed using the entity’s accounting policies and thresholds.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the proportion of ownership interests held by non-controlling interests for each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the consolidated financial statements under IFRS 12.12(c). The disclosure must provide the proportion of ownership interests held by non-controlling interests for each material subsidiary. Ensure the details align with IFRS 12 requirements, avoiding errors such as aggregating disclosure or omitting material subsidiaries.

items.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with non-controlling interests?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the proportion of voting rights held by non-controlling interests, if different from the proportion of ownership interests?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with non-controlling interests?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's consolidated financial statements and identify if any subsidiaries are not 100% owned by the parent. This information is typically disclosed in the notes to the financial statements, particularly in the section addressing 'Group Structure' or 'Non-Controlling Interests'.

yes_case.question: Is the proportion of voting rights held by non-controlling interests different from their proportion of ownership interests?
yes_case.guidance: Review the governance structure of subsidiaries with non-controlling interests. Check the voting arrangements and compare the proportion of ownership interests to the proportion of voting rights as disclosed in the notes. Common pitfalls: Ensure the disclosures align with the reality of the rights and avoid assuming equal proportions unless explicitly stated.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the proportion of voting rights held by non-controlling interests, as required by IFRS 12.12(d)?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to IFRS 12 paragraph 12(d). Ensure the notes to the financial statements clearly state the proportion of voting rights held by non-controlling interests where it differs from their ownership interests. Verify the accuracy and completeness of the disclosure. Be aware of instances where disclosures may be missing or insufficiently detailed.

items.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with non-controlling interests?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose dividends paid to non-controlling interests in each subsidiary?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with non-controlling interests?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity’s group structure as reported in the notes to the financial statements, specifically under IFRS 12 disclosures. Look for subsidiaries where ownership by the parent is less than 100%, resulting in non-controlling interests.

yes_case.question: Have dividends been paid to non-controlling interests during the reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Check the Statement of Changes in Equity and the notes to the financial statements. Look for transactions classified as dividends paid to non-controlling interests. Ensure that these payments are labeled properly and align with the entities mentioned under IFRS 12 disclosures.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the details of dividends paid to non-controlling interests for each subsidiary?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the notes to the financial statements under IFRS 12 disclosures. Look for a detailed breakdown by subsidiary, specifying the amount of dividends paid to non-controlling interests. Ensure the disclosure provides clarity and complies with IFRS 12.B10 requirements.

items.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose summarised financial information for each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests, including current assets, non-current assets, current liabilities, non-current liabilities, revenue, profit or loss and total comprehensive income?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have subsidiaries with material non-controlling interests?
decision_tree.guidance: Evaluate the entity's consolidated financial statements and notes to identify subsidiaries where non-controlling interests are significant in relation to the group's equity and performance. Look into IFRS 12.B10 for thresholds or examples defining 'material non-controlling interests'. Avoid assuming immateriality without sufficient quantitative and qualitative analysis.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose summarised financial information for each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes accompanying the consolidated financial statements. IFRS 12.B10 requires disclosure of specific summarised financial information for each relevant subsidiary, including current assets, non-current assets, current liabilities, non-current liabilities, revenue, profit or loss, and total comprehensive income. Ensure the disclosures are detailed enough to allow users of financial statements to evaluate the financial impact of non-controlling interests.

items.question: Does the entity have a group structure with a parent and subsidiaries?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose restrictions that limit a parent or its subsidiaries from transferring cash or other assets to or from other group entities?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have a group structure with a parent and subsidiaries?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's Consolidated Financial Statements and identify if there is a parent and one or more subsidiaries under the scope of IFRS 12. Check the organizational chart or notes to the financial statements for confirmation.

yes_case.question: Are there restrictions that limit the transfer of cash or other assets between the parent and its subsidiaries, or among subsidiaries?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements, specifically any disclosures regarding legal, regulatory, or contractual restrictions that prevent free movement of cash or other assets within the group. Pay attention to loan covenants, foreign exchange controls, or other restrictions imposed by external entities or jurisdictions. Ensure all relevant agreements and legal documentation are reviewed.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed these restrictions in accordance with IFRS 12.13(a)(i)?
yes_case.guidance: Review IFRS 12.13(a)(i), which requires disclosure of restrictions on the ability of subsidiaries to distribute profits or transfer assets to the parent. Check whether the restrictions are disclosed clearly in the financial statement notes, including the nature of the restrictions, their extent, and any implications for the group’s liquidity or operations.

items.question: Does the entity have group entities, such as subsidiaries, associates, or joint ventures?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose guarantees or other requirements that may restrict dividends, capital distributions, loans or advances between group entities?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have group entities, such as subsidiaries, associates, or joint ventures?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's organizational structure and financial statements. Check the Consolidated Statement of Financial Position and related notes for evidence of subsidiaries, associates, or joint ventures. Refer to IFRS 12 definitions for clarity.

yes_case.question: Do the group entities have any guarantees or requirements that may restrict dividends, capital distributions, loans, or advances?
yes_case.guidance: Examine contractual agreements, loan covenants, and restrictions disclosed in financial statements related to group entities. Pay special attention to guarantees provided by the parent entity on behalf of subsidiaries and restrictions imposed by regulators or financial institutions.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed these guarantees or restrictions in accordance with IFRS 12.13(a)(ii)?
yes_case.guidance: Review the relevant disclosure notes in the financial statements. IFRS 12.13(a)(ii) requires an entity to disclose guarantees or other restrictions that impact intra-group transactions relating to dividends, capital distributions, loans, or advances.

items.question: Does the entity have non-controlling interests in its subsidiaries?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the nature and extent to which protective rights of non-controlling interests can restrict access to or use of group assets and settlement of group liabilities?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have non-controlling interests in its subsidiaries?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the consolidated statement of financial position and ownership structure documentation (e.g., subsidiary details). Non-controlling interests are owners other than the parent entity that hold equity in subsidiaries. Confirm their existence in equity disclosures or notes.

yes_case.question: Do the non-controlling interests have protective rights that could restrict access to or use of group assets or settlement of group liabilities?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the agreements, contracts, or governance documents associated with the subsidiaries. Look for clauses specifying restrictions on decision-making, access to assets, or liability settlements impacted by protective rights of non-controlling interests.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the nature and extent of these restrictions in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Consult the notes to the consolidated financial statements, particularly the disclosures for non-controlling interests. Verify that the disclosure specifies the types of restrictions, the entities affected, and how these restrictions impact financial reporting.

items.question: Does the entity have assets and liabilities subject to restrictions disclosed in its consolidated financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the carrying amounts in its consolidated financial statements of the assets and liabilities subject to those restrictions?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have assets and liabilities subject to restrictions disclosed in its consolidated financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the consolidated financial statements and any notes on restrictions on assets or liabilities. Look for indications of legal, regulatory, or contractual restrictions affecting the entity's ability to utilize these assets or liabilities. Common areas include restricted cash, pledged assets, or items tied to covenants.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the carrying amounts of the assets and liabilities subject to those restrictions?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements for explicit disclosure of carrying amounts related to restricted assets and liabilities. Ensure alignment with IFRS 12.13(c), which requires this information to be clearly disclosed.

items.question: Does the entity have changes in its ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in a loss of control?
items.original_question: Does the entity present a schedule showing the effects on equity attributable to owners of the parent of any changes in its ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in a loss of control?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have changes in its ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in a loss of control?
decision_tree.guidance: Review IFRS 12.18 and the entity's group structure and transactions during the reporting period. Check notes to the financial statements and transaction records for changes in ownership interests where the subsidiary remains under control. Ensure you distinguish these transactions from changes that result in loss of control or de-recognition.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present a schedule showing the effects of these changes on equity attributable to owners of the parent?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements and the equity section of the Statement of Changes in Equity. Confirm that the effects of changes in ownership interests, specifically attributable to the parent, are clearly disclosed. The schedule should detail the impact on equity resulting from these transactions.

items.question: Has the entity lost control of a subsidiary during the reporting period?
items.original_question: When an entity loses control of a subsidiary, does it disclose the gain or loss calculated in accordance with IFRS 10.25?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity lost control of a subsidiary during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial records and disclosures for the reporting period. Refer to consolidation procedures in IFRS 10. Look for transactions or events indicating the loss of control, such as changes in ownership, legal arrangements, or significant governance changes. Ensure events are material and meet IFRS 10 control loss criteria.

yes_case.question: Has the entity calculated the gain or loss from losing control of the subsidiary in accordance with IFRS 10.25?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to IFRS 10.25. Verify if the entity has calculated the gain or loss by comparing the consideration received and the carrying amount of the subsidiary's net assets at the loss of control date. Include amounts for previously recognized other comprehensive income attributed to the subsidiary. Check calculations against IFRS 10 guidance for accuracy.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the gain or loss from the loss of control of the subsidiary, as required by IFRS 12.19(a)?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to IFRS 12.19(a). Review the entity's notes to the financial statements for disclosure of the gain or loss calculated under IFRS 10.25. Ensure disclosure includes clear communication of the amount, reason for loss of control, and compliance with IFRS presentation standards.

items.question: Has the entity lost control of a subsidiary during the reporting period?
items.original_question: When an entity loses control of a subsidiary, does it disclose the line item(s) in profit or loss in which the gain or loss is recognised if not presented separately?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity lost control of a subsidiary during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial records for the reporting period and check for any derecognition events of subsidiaries. Look at transactional records and Notes to the Financial Statements. Verify that loss of control complies with IFRS 10.25–27, which governs control loss due to disposals or other changes.

yes_case.question: Is the gain or loss from the loss of control of the subsidiary presented separately in the profit or loss statement?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the Statement of Profit or Loss and Other Comprehensive Income. Review whether the gain or loss is clearly presented as a separate line item. Check the format and structure against IFRS presentation requirements.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose the line item(s) in profit or loss where the gain or loss is recognized?
no_case.guidance: Inspect the Notes to the Financial Statements for specific disclosure of what line item(s) absorb the gain or loss. Refer to IFRS 12.19(c) for disclosure requirements in this scenario. Ensure the disclosure is detailed and informative to users of financial statements.

items.question: Is the reporting entity a parent that has determined it is an investment entity in accordance with IFRS 10.27?
items.original_question: When a parent determines that it is an investment entity in accordance with IFRS 10.27, does it disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in making that determination?

decision_tree.question: Is the reporting entity a parent that has determined it is an investment entity in accordance with IFRS 10.27?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's accounting policies and disclosures against the criteria in IFRS 10.27 to determine if it qualifies as an investment entity. Investment entities are commonly characterized by providing services to multiple investors, acting as a collective vehicle for investing, demonstrating fair value-focused reporting, and lacking substantive business activities beyond investing.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the significant judgements and assumptions made in identifying itself as an investment entity in accordance with IFRS 12.9A?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosure notes section of the financial statements to confirm that the entity has explicitly stated the significant judgements and assumptions used to determine it is an investment entity, such as meeting the description and criteria set out in IFRS 10.27. Lack of these disclosures constitutes non-compliance.

items.question: Does the entity qualify as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
items.original_question: If the investment entity lacks one or more typical characteristics (see IFRS 10.28), does it disclose its reasons for concluding that it is nevertheless an investment entity?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity qualify as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's classification against the definition and criteria specified in IFRS 10.27. An investment entity typically obtains funds from investors to provide investment management services, commits to investing solely for returns, and measures substantially all investments at fair value. Refer to IFRS 10.B85-B87 for detailed examples and guidance.

yes_case.question: Does the investment entity lack one or more of the typical characteristics outlined in IFRS 10.28?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to IFRS 10.28, which lists typical characteristics of an investment entity, such as having multiple investors, having ownership interests in the form of equity/debt, and holding investments only for capital appreciation/investment income. Confirm whether the entity deviates from one or more of these characteristics.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed its reasons for concluding that it is nevertheless an investment entity despite lacking typical characteristics?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements' disclosures for the explanation of why the entity qualifies as an investment entity even though it lacks one or more typical characteristics. The disclosure should be clear and specific, as required by IFRS 12.9A.

items.question: Has the entity undergone a change in status, becoming or ceasing to be an investment entity during the reporting period?
items.original_question: When an entity becomes or ceases to be an investment entity, does it disclose the change in status and the reasons for the change?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity undergone a change in status, becoming or ceasing to be an investment entity during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and supporting notes for changes in the investment entity status. Check board resolutions, shareholder meeting minutes, or management decisions recorded during the reporting period that explicitly state a status change. Ensure you validate this against IFRS 12 definitions of an investment entity.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the change in status in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Verify whether the disclosure is included in the notes to the financial statements. It should specify the change in status, referencing the IFRS definition, and explain the reasons behind the change. Common pitfalls include omitting the justification or vague reasoning.

no_case.question: Has the entity provided the reasons for the change in status along with the disclosure?
no_case.guidance: In addition to disclosure, confirm that the notes explicitly state the reasons for the change in status as required by IFRS 12.9B. The reasons should be clear, specific, and consistent with other financial statement disclosures.

items.question: Has the entity undergone a change in status to become an investment entity during the reporting period?
items.original_question: When an entity becomes an investment entity, does it disclose the total fair value, as of the date of change of status, of the subsidiaries that cease to be consolidated?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity undergone a change in status to become an investment entity during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review board minutes, organizational structure, and IFRS 12 criteria to determine if the entity has transitioned into meeting the definition of an investment entity during the reporting period. Reference IFRS 10.B85C for the criteria defining an investment entity and ensure supporting documentation is reviewed.

yes_case.question: Did the entity have subsidiaries that ceased to be consolidated due to this change in status?
yes_case.guidance: Identify if the entity previously consolidated subsidiaries before the change in status and whether those subsidiaries meet the scope outlined in IFRS 12.9B(a). Check prior financial statements and the entity's new accounting policy disclosures.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the total fair value, as of the date of the change in status, of these subsidiaries?
yes_case.guidance: Verify disclosures in the notes to the financial statements. Look for a clear statement specifying the total fair value of the subsidiaries as at the date the entity became an investment entity. This is required under IFRS 12.9B.

items.question: Has the entity become an investment entity during the reporting period?
items.original_question: When an entity becomes an investment entity, does it disclose the total gain or loss, if any, calculated in accordance with IFRS 10.B101?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity become an investment entity during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the entity’s classification in accordance with IFRS 10.27-29. An investment entity is defined by characteristics such as obtaining funds for investing purposes and measuring returns for investors at fair value. Review the entity's documentation and classification changes.

yes_case.question: Did the entity calculate the total gain or loss, if any, as required by IFRS 10.B101?
yes_case.guidance: Review the calculation of gain or loss during the reclassification event. Ensure adherence to IFRS 10.B101, including the treatment of the assets being consolidated before the entity qualifies as an investment entity. Verify methodology for determining fair value changes.

yes_case.question: Did the entity disclose the total gain or loss in accordance with IFRS 12.9B(b)?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the financial statements, specifically the notes section. Verify if the entity has disclosed the total gain or loss during the reclassification event as required by IFRS 12.9B(b). Ensure disclosures include sufficient detail for users to understand the financial impact.

items.question: Has the entity recently become an investment entity?
items.original_question: When an entity becomes an investment entity, does it disclose the line item(s) in profit or loss in which the gain or loss is recognised if not presented separately?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity recently become an investment entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity’s financial statements and board or management declarations to confirm its classification as an investment entity. The classification should align with the criteria outlined in IFRS 10.27, such as the entity deriving returns principally from capital appreciation, investment income, or both. Verify if the change in classification occurred during the reporting period.

yes_case.question: Did the entity recognise any gain or loss in profit or loss as a result of becoming an investment entity?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the profit or loss section of the financial statements for recognised gains or losses resulting from the change to investment entity status. This may include fair value adjustments or derecognition impacts related to subsidiaries as required by IFRS 10. Keep in mind that such gains or losses are specific to the transition and should be identifiable as line items in the profit or loss.

yes_case.question: Is the gain or loss presented separately as a distinct line item in profit or loss?
yes_case.guidance: Check the presentation in the Statement of Profit or Loss. IFRS requires that material gains or losses are either presented as separate line items or disclosed. If material amounts are included within other line items without proper disclosure, it may raise a compliance issue.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose the line item(s) in profit or loss in which the gain or loss is recognised?
no_case.guidance: Assess the notes to the financial statements for disclosure of the specific line items in which the gain or loss is recorded. The disclosure should clearly communicate to users of financial statements where these gains or losses are reported, as mandated by IFRS 12.9B(c).

items.question: Is the entity classified as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
items.original_question: Does an investment entity that applies the consolidation exception and accounts for a subsidiary at fair value through profit or loss disclose that fact?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity classified as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to IFRS 10 Appendix A for the definition of an investment entity. Review the entity's organizational purpose, activities, and characteristics in its governance documents and financial statements. Key indicators include obtaining funds from investors, managing investments for returns, and measuring performance primarily by fair value.

yes_case.question: Does the entity apply the consolidation exception and account for a subsidiary at fair value through profit or loss as required under IFRS 10.31?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to IFRS 10.31 to determine if the entity is exempted from consolidating subsidiaries because it qualifies as an investment entity. Check financial statement disclosures and ensure subsidiaries are accounted for at fair value through profit or loss.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose in the financial statements that it applies the consolidation exception and accounts for a subsidiary at fair value through profit or loss, as required by IFRS 12.19A?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity's financial statement disclosures, specifically under the notes to the financial statements. Verify that the entity explicitly states it applies the consolidation exception and accounts for subsidiaries at fair value through profit or loss.

items.question: Does the entity qualify as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
items.original_question: For each unconsolidated subsidiary, does an investment entity disclose the subsidiary's name?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity qualify as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to IFRS 10.27 for the definition of an investment entity. Review if the entity holds investments solely for capital appreciation, investing returns, or both, and if it measures investments at fair value through profit or loss as required.

yes_case.question: Does the entity have any unconsolidated subsidiaries?
yes_case.guidance: Check the consolidated financial statements or notes for references to subsidiaries that are controlled but not consolidated, as permitted for investment entities under IFRS 10. Review the list of investments in subsidiaries and confirm their consolidation status.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the names of all unconsolidated subsidiaries?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the notes to the financial statements for details of unconsolidated subsidiaries. The names of all such subsidiaries should be explicitly listed as per IFRS 12.19B(a). Ensure completeness by cross-referencing the list of subsidiaries with internal records.

items.question: Does the entity qualify as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
items.original_question: For each unconsolidated subsidiary, does an investment entity disclose the principal place of business (and country of incorporation, if different)?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity qualify as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and entity classification criteria under IFRS 10. Confirm if the entity meets the definition of an investment entity. Look for characteristics such as: obtaining funds from investors to provide investment management services, committing to investors that its business purpose is investing solely for returns, and measuring its investments at fair value. References: IFRS 10.27–33.

yes_case.question: Does the entity have any unconsolidated subsidiaries?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the entity’s group structure and investment disclosures, specifically focusing on subsidiaries that are not consolidated into its financial statements. Refer to the consolidation section of IFRS 10 (IFRS 10.6–7).

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the principal place of business for each unconsolidated subsidiary?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the notes to the financial statements for disclosure of the principal place of business for each unconsolidated subsidiary. Check whether the entity specifies the country of incorporation if it differs from the principal place of business. Refer to IFRS 12.19B(b).

items.question: Does the entity have any unconsolidated subsidiaries?
items.original_question: For each unconsolidated subsidiary, does an investment entity disclose the proportion of ownership interest held and, if different, the proportion of voting rights held?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have any unconsolidated subsidiaries?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity’s financial statements, particularly the notes related to investments in subsidiaries. Look for references to unconsolidated subsidiaries, typically disclosed when the entity qualifies as an investment entity under IFRS 10 Consolidated Financial Statements.

yes_case.question: Is the entity classified as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements for statements qualifying the entity as an investment entity. Verify criteria such as the entity earning returns from capital appreciation, investment income, or both, and its management of investments on a fair value basis.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the proportion of ownership interest held for each unconsolidated subsidiary?
yes_case.guidance: Review disclosures in compliance with IFRS 12 Section 19B(c). Ensure the proportion of ownership interest held is included for each subsidiary where consolidation does not occur.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the proportion of voting rights held for each unconsolidated subsidiary, if different from the ownership interest?
yes_case.guidance: Check the same section of disclosures for voting rights information. This is applicable only if the voting rights differ from the ownership interest. Cross-check for completeness and accuracy.

items.question: Is the reporting entity an investment entity under IFRS 12?
items.original_question: If an investment entity is the parent of another investment entity, does it provide the disclosures in IFRS 12.19B for investments controlled by its investment entity subsidiary?

decision_tree.question: Is the reporting entity an investment entity under IFRS 12?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statement disclosures and confirm its classification as an investment entity. IFRS defines an investment entity as one that obtains funds from one or more investors for providing investment management services, commits to its investors that its business purpose is to invest solely for returns from capital appreciation, investment income, or both, and measures and evaluates the performance of substantially all of its investments on a fair value basis. Consult IFRS 10.B85B for detailed criteria.

yes_case.question: Is the investment entity the parent of another investment entity?
yes_case.guidance: Review the group structure in the consolidated financial statements or notes to determine if the reporting entity has investment entity subsidiaries. Investment entity subsidiaries are those that meet the IFRS definition of an investment entity and are controlled by the parent investment entity.

yes_case.question: Does the parent investment entity provide the disclosures specified in IFRS 12.19B for investments controlled by its investment entity subsidiary?
yes_case.guidance: Verify whether IFRS 12.19B disclosures are provided for investments held by the subsidiary. These disclosures include information about the nature and extent of any significant restrictions (e.g., legal, regulatory, contractual) on the subsidiary investing funds or transferring assets to the parent, commitments or intentions related to the disposal of investments, and any risks arising from changes in fair value.

items.question: Does the entity qualify as an investment entity under IFRS?
items.original_question: Does an investment entity disclose the nature and extent of any significant restrictions on an unconsolidated subsidiary's ability to transfer funds to the investment entity as dividends or to repay loans or advances?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity qualify as an investment entity under IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and business model. Refer to IFRS 10 paragraphs 27 and B85B-B85M for the definition of an investment entity. Investment entities typically hold investments for returns from capital appreciation, investment income, or both, and do not have operating entities within the group.

yes_case.question: Does the investment entity have any unconsolidated subsidiaries as per IFRS 12?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosures in the consolidated financial statements and any related notes. Verify whether the subsidiaries meet the criteria for exclusion from consolidation under IFRS 10 and are accounted for as investments.

yes_case.question: Are there significant restrictions on an unconsolidated subsidiary’s ability to transfer funds to the investment entity as dividends or to repay loans or advances?
yes_case.guidance: Consider restrictive covenants, regulatory limitations, or other agreements that may limit such transfers. Verify these details in the notes to the financial statements, along with any supporting contracts or legal documents.

yes_case.question: Has the nature and extent of these significant restrictions been disclosed in accordance with IFRS 12.19D(a)?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements under the section for unconsolidated subsidiaries. Disclosure should specifically mention the restrictions, their nature, and extent, in sufficient detail to inform users of financial statements.

items.question: Does the entity qualify as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
items.original_question: Does an investment entity disclose any current commitments or intentions to provide financial or other support to an unconsolidated subsidiary, including assistance in obtaining financial support?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity qualify as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to IFRS 10 paragraphs 27-33 for the definition and criteria of an investment entity. An investment entity is one whose primary business purpose is investing funds for returns, measures and evaluates investments on a fair value basis, and may have multiple investors and exit strategies. Review the entity's financial statements and management's discussion for confirmation.

yes_case.question: Does the investment entity have any unconsolidated subsidiaries?
yes_case.guidance: Check the entity's consolidated or standalone financial statements for disclosures about subsidiaries. Specifically, look for references to unconsolidated subsidiaries in the notes to the financial statements or any related disclosures.

yes_case.question: Does the investment entity have any current commitments or intentions to provide financial or other support to an unconsolidated subsidiary?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements under IFRS 12 disclosures and any additional statements regarding commitments or support. Look for specific details that mention financial support, guarantees, or assistance in obtaining financial support.

yes_case.question: Are these current commitments or intentions adequately disclosed in line with IFRS 12.19D(b)?
yes_case.guidance: Confirm that disclosures include descriptions of such commitments or intentions, the amounts involved, and the nature or reason for the support. Evaluate whether the disclosures provide sufficient information to users of financial statements.

items.question: Did the investment entity or any of its subsidiaries provide support to an unconsolidated subsidiary during the reporting period?
items.original_question: If, without contractual obligation, an investment entity or its subsidiaries provided support to an unconsolidated subsidiary, does it disclose the type and amount of support provided to each subsidiary?

decision_tree.question: Did the investment entity or any of its subsidiaries provide support to an unconsolidated subsidiary during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review records of transactions and arrangements involving unconsolidated subsidiaries, including any financial or operational assistance provided without a contractual obligation. Common sources include related party transactions documentation, board minutes, or management records.

yes_case.question: Was the provision of support made without a contractual obligation?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the agreements or contracts between the investment entity and the unconsolidated subsidiary. Confirm if the support was voluntary and not mandated by legally enforceable agreements. Avoid misclassification by thoroughly verifying the absence of formal contracts.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the type and amount of support provided to each unconsolidated subsidiary?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements. Specifically, look for disclosures under IFRS 12.19E(a) detailing the nature (e.g., financial assistance, operational interventions) and monetary value of the support provided to each unconsolidated subsidiary. Ensure the disclosures are complete and sufficiently detailed.

items.question: Has the investment entity or its subsidiaries provided support to an unconsolidated subsidiary without contractual obligation?
items.original_question: If, without contractual obligation, an investment entity or its subsidiaries provided support to an unconsolidated subsidiary, does it disclose the reasons for providing that support?

decision_tree.question: Has the investment entity or its subsidiaries provided support to an unconsolidated subsidiary without contractual obligation?
decision_tree.guidance: Review relevant transactions or events where the investment entity or its subsidiaries may have given financial or other types of support (e.g., loans, guarantees, payments) to unconsolidated subsidiaries outside of any contractual agreements. Check board minutes, related party transaction disclosures, and correspondence for evidence of such support. Be cautious about overlooking informal agreements.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reasons for providing the support to the unconsolidated subsidiary?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the entity's notes to the financial statements, specifically those addressing IFRS 12 disclosures about unconsolidated subsidiaries. Look for explanations detailing why the support was provided, aligned with the requirements of IFRS 12.19E(b). Ensure the disclosure is clear, complete, and not misleading.

items.question: Is the entity classified as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
items.original_question: Does an investment entity disclose the terms of any contractual arrangements that could require it or its unconsolidated subsidiaries to provide financial support to a controlled structured entity, including events or circumstances that could expose it to a loss?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity classified as an investment entity under IFRS 10?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and entity classification criteria in IFRS 10 paragraphs 27-33. An investment entity typically earns returns from capital appreciation, investment income, or both. Ensure the entity does not consolidate its subsidiaries except when an exception applies. Common pitfalls include assuming the entity is an investment entity without verifying the criteria.

yes_case.question: Does the entity have unconsolidated subsidiaries that qualify as controlled structured entities?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity's list of subsidiaries in its disclosures and determine if any are controlled structured entities. Controlled structured entities often involve entities created for specific purposes, such as securitization or investment purposes. Verify control following IFRS 10 criteria like power over a structured entity and exposure to variable returns. Be cautious to distinguish structured entities from other unconsolidated subsidiaries.

yes_case.question: Are there any contractual arrangements that require the entity or its unconsolidated subsidiaries to provide financial support to these structured entities?
yes_case.guidance: Analyze the entity's agreements and contracts with structured entities. Look for clauses that mandate financial support, including guarantees, funding agreements, or other forms of obligations linked to losses or liquidity needs. Focus on IFRS 12 paragraph 19F requirements to identify relevant events or conditions. Ensure no terms are overlooked that would expose the entity to potential financial losses.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the terms of these contractual arrangements, including events or circumstances that could expose it to a loss?
yes_case.guidance: Verify disclosure in the notes to the financial statements regarding the terms of contractual arrangements with controlled structured entities. Relevant IFRS 12 disclosures should include details about triggers of financial obligations and potential exposure to losses. Ensure the entity meets the quantitative and qualitative disclosure requirements under IFRS 12.19F.

items.question: Has the entity or its unconsolidated subsidiaries provided support to a structured entity they did not control, without contractual obligation?
items.original_question: If, without contractual obligation, an investment entity or its unconsolidated subsidiaries provided support to a structured entity they did not control and that support resulted in control, does the entity disclose an explanation of the factors leading to that decision?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity or its unconsolidated subsidiaries provided support to a structured entity they did not control, without contractual obligation?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the investment entity’s records, including contracts, agreements, and financial statements. Look for evidence of financial or operational support to a structured entity that does not arise from a legal or contractual requirement.

yes_case.question: Did the support provided result in the entity or its unconsolidated subsidiaries obtaining control of the structured entity?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the structured entity’s governance documents, voting rights arrangements, and other factors indicating control as per IFRS 10.7 – such as power over governing decisions, exposure to variable returns, and ability to influence those returns.

yes_case.question: Did the entity disclose an explanation of the factors that led to the provision of support and subsequent control?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity’s disclosures in its financial statements. Specifically, check for explanatory notes addressing the circumstances and factors leading to the provision of support and resulting control, as required by IFRS 12.19G.

items.question: Does the entity participate in a joint arrangement?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it has joint control of an arrangement?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity participate in a joint arrangement?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's contracts, agreements, and financial statements for any arrangements classified as joint ventures or joint operations, as defined by IFRS 11. Cross-reference Section B14–B33 of IFRS 11 for criteria determining joint arrangements.

yes_case.question: Has the entity determined that it has joint control over the arrangement?
yes_case.guidance: Check the entity's documentation on joint control assessment. Joint control exists when decisions about relevant activities require unanimous consent of all parties. Verify supporting agreements and meeting minutes detailing decision-making processes.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining joint control of the arrangement?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the entity's financial statement notes, specifically disclosures related to joint arrangements (IFRS 12.7(a)). Ensure the disclosure includes specific judgements and assumptions, such as unanimous decision-making requirement or contractual terms used as the basis for joint control.

items.question: Does the entity have a joint arrangement structured through a separate vehicle?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining the type of joint arrangement (joint operation or joint venture) when structured through a separate vehicle?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have a joint arrangement structured through a separate vehicle?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the joint arrangement agreements and the financial statements to identify any joint arrangements. Check if there is evidence that the arrangement is conducted through a legally separate entity (e.g., corporation, partnership, or trust). Common pitfalls include overlooking arrangements classified as joint operations due to shared control.

yes_case.question: Has the entity determined the type of joint arrangement (joint operation or joint venture) based on the rights and obligations inherent in the arrangement?
yes_case.guidance: Assess whether the entity has analyzed the contractual terms of the arrangement, other facts and circumstances, and the legal form of the arrangement as per IFRS 11.B14-B33. Common errors involve failing to consider rights to assets and obligations for liabilities, instead relying solely on the legal form.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining the type of joint arrangement?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosure notes in the financial statements, specifically those related to IFRS 12 Section 7(b). Ensure the entity has identified and disclosed any assumptions, such as whether certain rights or obligations influenced their classification decision. Missing this disclosure is a common compliance issue.

items.question: Did the entity experience any changes in facts and circumstances during the reporting period that could impact the conclusion about joint control?
items.original_question: Does the entity include under those judgements and assumptions any made when changes in facts and circumstances cause the conclusion about joint control to change during the reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity experience any changes in facts and circumstances during the reporting period that could impact the conclusion about joint control?
decision_tree.guidance: Review agreements related to joint arrangements, significant events, or other contractual changes. Additionally, check for any changes in operational practices or relationships with joint arrangement participants. Pay attention to board minutes, contracts, or external communications indicating altered circumstances.

yes_case.question: Did the entity reassess and document whether joint control exists based on the updated facts and circumstances?
yes_case.guidance: Verify whether the reassessment process followed IFRS 12. Assess whether the entity correctly evaluated whether the changes affected the enforceability of joint control. Look for properly documented judgments in accounting policies, disclosures, and the reporting analysis.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the judgements and assumptions made during the reassessment process in compliance with IFRS 12.8?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements for disclosure of specific judgements and assumptions in line with IFRS 12.8. Ensure these include the nature of the changes and the reasoning for the new conclusion regarding joint control. The disclosure should be sufficient to inform users of the financial statements.

items.question: Does the entity have interests in joint arrangements?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose information to evaluate the nature, extent and financial effects of its interests in joint arrangements, including the nature and effects of its contractual relationship with other investors with joint control?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have interests in joint arrangements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements, specifically the notes or disclosures, for any mention of joint arrangements under IFRS 11. Joint arrangements include joint ventures and joint operations, where control is shared contractually with other parties. Verify agreements and contracts for shared control to confirm the existence of such arrangements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose information sufficient to evaluate the nature, extent, and financial effects of its interests in joint arrangements?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the disclosures in the financial statements. IFRS 12.20(a) requires details about the entity’s interests in joint arrangements, their nature, the extent of involvement in terms of assets, liabilities, revenues, and expenses, as well as the financial effects of the arrangements. Review the contracts and agreements to ensure alignment with the disclosed information.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose the nature and effects of its contractual relationships with other investors having joint control?
no_case.guidance: Check whether the entity discloses the nature of its involvement and the contractual terms governing the joint arrangement, such as agreement specifics with other investors who hold joint control. Confirm if these disclosures align with the requirements of IFRS 12.20(a).

items.question: Does the entity have any interests in joint ventures?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose information to evaluate the nature of, and changes in, the risks associated with its interests in joint ventures?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have any interests in joint ventures?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements, particularly the notes on investments and joint arrangements, and confirm whether the entity is involved in any joint ventures based on IFRS 11 definitions. Joint ventures typically involve shared control and require contractual arrangements. Be aware of potential misclassification of joint operations as joint ventures.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose information to evaluate the nature of its risks associated with interests in joint ventures?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statement disclosures and notes related to joint ventures. Look for qualitative and quantitative details that provide insights into the nature of risks (e.g., credit risk, liquidity risk) arising from the joint venture. Ensure these disclosures align with IFRS 12.20(b).

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose information about changes in risks associated with its interests in joint ventures?
yes_case.guidance: Check the continuity schedules and narrative notes concerning the entity’s joint ventures for explanations of any changes in risks over the reporting period. Common changes may include amendments to the joint venture agreement, shifts in market conditions, or operational events.

items.question: Does the entity have any material joint arrangements?
items.original_question: For each material joint arrangement, does the entity disclose the name of the joint arrangement?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have any material joint arrangements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's agreements and financial statements, specifically the notes to the financial statements under IFRS 12 disclosures. Look for joint arrangements defined as joint operations or joint ventures pursuant to IFRS 11. Verify whether any of these arrangements are considered material based on qualitative and quantitative factors.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the name of each material joint arrangement?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the entity's financial statement notes under IFRS 12.21(a)(i) to ensure the names of all material joint arrangements are disclosed. Cross-check this information against agreements and supporting documents to verify completeness. Common mistakes include omitting immaterial arrangements or using outdated names.

items.question: Does the entity have any material joint arrangements?
items.original_question: For each material joint arrangement, does the entity describe the nature of its relationship with the arrangement (e.g., nature of activities and strategic importance)?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have any material joint arrangements?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to the financial statements and accompanying notes. Check whether the entity has disclosed any joint arrangements that are considered material. A joint arrangement could be a joint venture or a joint operation. Ensure materiality is assessed per IFRS 12. For assessment, review IFRS 12.17 and 12.18 for determining 'material' relevance based on size, nature, and strategic significance.

yes_case.question: Has the entity described the nature of its relationship with its material joint arrangements, including the nature of activities and strategic importance?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements. Look for descriptive disclosures as required by IFRS 12.21(a)(ii). Ensure the entity has provided meaningful information about its relationship with each material joint arrangement, including details of activities and strategic importance to the entity. Avoid generic or incomplete disclosures.

items.question: Does the entity have at least one material joint arrangement?
items.original_question: For each material joint arrangement, does the entity disclose the principal place of business (and country of incorporation, if different)?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have at least one material joint arrangement?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and supporting documentation. Refer to IFRS 12.7 to determine if any joint arrangements are classified as material based on quantitative and qualitative factors. Materiality should be assessed in relation to overall financial statement impact.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the principal place of business for each material joint arrangement?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the entity’s financial statement disclosures, specifically the notes section under IFRS 12 compliance. Ensure the principal place of business of each material joint arrangement is clearly stated.

yes_case.question: If the country of incorporation differs from the principal place of business, has the entity disclosed the country of incorporation for each material joint arrangement?
yes_case.guidance: Verify if the notes or disclosures include the country of incorporation for each material joint arrangement where necessary. IFRS 12.21(a)(iii) requires this additional disclosure only when the locations differ.

items.question: Does the entity have any material joint arrangements?
items.original_question: For each material joint arrangement, does the entity disclose the proportion of ownership interest or participating share and, if different, the proportion of voting rights held?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have any material joint arrangements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review agreements, contracts, or partnerships listed in the entity’s financial records or disclosures (e.g., investment notes or joint venture agreements). Refer to the definition of 'joint arrangements' in IFRS 11. Confirm these arrangements meet the materiality threshold as per IFRS Practice Statement 2.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the proportion of ownership interest or participating share for each material joint arrangement?
yes_case.guidance: Check financial statements, specifically notes on joint arrangements. The ownership interest or participating share should be clearly quantified for each arrangement. Verify against IFRS 12.21(a)(iv).

yes_case.question: If the proportion of voting rights held differs from ownership interest, does the entity disclose the proportion of voting rights held for each material joint arrangement?
yes_case.guidance: Review joint arrangement disclosures. If voting rights are not aligned with ownership interest, they must be separately disclosed under IFRS 12.21(a)(iv). Watch for cases where voting control differs due to agreements or share structures.

items.question: Does the entity have any material joint ventures?
items.original_question: For each material joint venture, does the entity disclose whether the investment is measured using the equity method or at fair value?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have any material joint ventures?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's consolidated financial statements and notes to identify if there are any joint ventures classified as material under IFRS 12. Materiality should be assessed based on the quantitative and qualitative criteria provided in IAS 1.
